title: 4 people, including juvenile, hurt in apparent drive-by shooting in Long Beach
content:
LONG BEACH, Calif. (KABC) --
Four people, including a juvenile, were injured in an apparent drive-by shooting in Long Beach.
The shooting happened around 10:30 p.m. Monday on the 1700 block of East 10th Street.
All four victims - a male juvenile, two men and a woman - were taken to the hospital and were expected to survive. Police said the juvenile was in stable but critical condition.
It was unknown if the victims are gang members, but Long Beach police said the shooting may possibly be gang related.
A suspect description was not available.
